channel.title: Accountability
channel.description:
members of staff can do all sorts of retarded shit and get away with it, why?
the most noticeable example is the warning system, there is no logging and as such it is impossible to know which member of staff warned a user or allowed a moderated post
rulereric has a good system where bannings are open for the world to see: http://www.rscheata.net/forum/index.php?action=banlist
what the hell is wrong with this community that rulereric has a better system?

[quote author=frank_ link=topic=397178.msg2951447#msg2951447 date=1252535167]

Also, maybe the staff clicked the wrong button, it happens you know, ever pressed preview on your post instead of post? Except there is no ‘undo’ button for the warning system.
[/quote]they are unable to track down and delete the post?

That is correct, they only know the name of the poster, and the text of the post.

and they can go to the persons user profile and press ‘see recent posts’.
it should be right at the top

That’s where it starts taking time though and that’s when posts clog up.
[/quote]then the member of staff should do it properly the first time

stop making excuses ty

Not to mention the posts aren’t at the top of the ‘latest posts’, but instead are at the time they were originally posted. (not when approved)

Bottom line is, the moderation system is the worst possible.

[size=1pt]
Make a better one?[/size][/quote]

That’s one of the positives of upgrading to 2.0. The warn system in there actually works.

item.title: Accountability
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

I think my suggestion here is better to be public than private. Whether or not you know this Moparisthebest, SMF 2.0’s warning system supports three warning status modes:

-Moderators Only
-Moderators and Warned Users
-All Users

Obviously, the current system only supports ‘All Users’. You could easily set it up to only display infractions to moderators and warned users. It would reduce the amount of public outcry of warnings, but would also reduce the amount of “punishment” involved.

I also believe that 2.0’s warning system only shows infractions on user’s profiles, not on their posts or messages. Whether this is a minus, I’m not sure. That alone might be good enough even if it does have the status mode of ‘All Users’.

Read full topic

Staff is not perfect you know, and what is far from perfect is this hack-job of a warning system we have. It shows us a name and a post, not a thread, board or even whether it is on moparisthebest.com or moparisthebest.com. So if it was a private server thread for example, the moderator would have approved it thinking it may be on moparisthebest.com, because there is no way of knowing, understand?

Also, maybe the staff clicked the wrong button, it happens you know, ever pressed preview on your post instead of post? Except there is no ‘undo’ button for the warning system.

However, some good might come from this thread, I like the public ban thing.

edit: Oh, also the ‘approve posts’ interface does not show pictures at all, crappy isn’t it?
